paper.title: Bayes and Pseudo-Bayes Estimates of Conditional Probabilities and Their Reliability

author.org: Centre for Logic and Probability in IT, King's College, London, UK

paper.abstract: Various ways of estimating probabilities, mainly within the Bayesian framework, are discussed. Their relevance and application to machine learning is given, and their relative performance empirically evaluated. A method of accounting for noisy data is given and also applied. The reliability of estimates is measured by a significance measure, which is also empirically tested. We briefly discuss the use of likelihood ratio as a significance measure.
